com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder

Class InBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder.CharsetHolder<InBuilder>
      • com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder.InBuilder

  • public class InBuilder
extends CharsetHolder<InBuilder>
    This builder is used to create an input chain.
    Author:
    Manuel Hegner

    • Constructor Detail

      • InBuilder

        public InBuilder(Source source)

    • Method Detail

      • decompress

        public InBuilder decompress()
        This method will tell the builder to decompress the bytes. The returned reader or stream will contain an appropriate decompressor. If the defined source specifies a name with a file ending, the builder will try to use the appropriate decompressor for the file extension. If there is no extension or it is unknown this simply adds a DeflaterOutputStream to the chain. If you want to add file extensions to the automatic selection see CompressorRegistry.registerWrapper(java.lang.String, com.github.powerlibraries.io.helper.InputStreamWrapper, com.github.powerlibraries.io.helper.OutputStreamWrapper).
        Returns:
        this builder

      • decodeBase64

        public InBuilder decodeBase64()
        This method will add a Base64.Decoder to this chain.
        Returns:
        this builder

      • decodeBase64

        public InBuilder decodeBase64(java.util.Base64.Decoder decoder)
        This method will add a Base64.Decoder to this chain.
        Parameters:
        decoder - the specific decoder that should be used.
        Returns:
        this builder

      • asStream

        public java.io.InputStream asStream()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a simple InputStream from this builder with all the chosen options.
        Returns:
        an InputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • asReader

        public java.io.BufferedReader asReader()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates a BufferedReader from this builder with all the chosen options. It uses the default Charset for that.
        Returns:
        a BufferedReader
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • asObjects

        public java.io.ObjectInputStream asObjects()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates an ObjectInputStream from this builder with all the chosen options.
        Returns:
        a ObjectInputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • readXML

        public org.w3c.dom.Document readXML()
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.xml.sax.SAXException
        This method reads an XML document from the selected source into a Document. It uses a default DocumentBuilderFactory and DocumentBuilder.
        Returns:
        the parsed Document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if any parse errors occur

      • readXML

        public org.w3c.dom.Document readXML(javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder documentBuilder)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.xml.sax.SAXException
        This method reads an XML document from the selected source into a Document.
        Parameters:
        documentBuilder - a fresh DocumentBuilder that is used as parser
        Returns:
        the parsed Document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if any parse errors occur

      • readAll

        public java.lang.String readAll()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the complete input in a String. Lines are seperated with a single '\n'.
        Returns:
        a String containing the whole content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • readObject

        public <T> T readObject()
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        This method simply reads the first object from the input using an ObjectInputStream and returns it.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected type of the read object
        Returns:
        the read Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found.
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • readObjects

        public <T> java.util.List<T> readObjects()
                                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                         java.io.IOException
        This method reads as many objects from the input using an ObjectInputStream as it can and returns them. Be aware that this method will throw an exception if there are other information in the stream than objects (e.g. primitives).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the expected supertype of the read objects
        Returns:
        a list of read objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found.
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • readLines

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readLines()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the complete input in a List of Strings. Each element of the list represents one line of the source document.
        Returns:
        a list of lines containing the whole content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(java.io.OutputStream out)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the content of this InputStream to the given OutputStream. This does not close the OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream to copy to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(java.io.Writer out)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the content of this BufferedReader to the given Writer. This does not close the Writer.
        Parameters:
        out - the Writer to copy to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • streamLines

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> streamLines()
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the complete input in a Stream of Strings. Each element of the stream represents one line of the source document. The stream is lazily populated. Be aware that the created reader is only closed if the created stream is closed.
        Returns:
        a Stream containing the lines of this input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • getSource

        public Source getSource()
        Returns:
        the source used by this InBuilder
